creditline: Gift of the Miller Family Collection in memory of Dulcy B. Miller
description: figure from waist up; curly hair and long, curly beard; lion skin draped over PL shoulder; PR arm lost; PL arm lost; broken off diagonally on bottom of R edge; large flat surface loss on back; mounted on black base
text:
In antique art there were representations of both the wise, sober Silenus and the drunken one. Silenus was outstanding among his fellow silenoi for his wisdom, which he may have inherited from the union of his mother, a nymph, with one of the divinities (Hermes or Pan).

Seated on a fragmentary wineskin, wearing an ivy wreath in his hair and a panther skin draped on his left shoulder, this Silenus appears to be dozing after a round of Dionysian revelry. The grape wreath in his curly hair confirms that his current state is more the result of his actions than of his age.
title: Seated Silenus
